about.name: Austin
about.info_text: Austin, the capital of Texas, is a vibrant and culturally rich city known for its live music scene, outdoor activities, and unique local culture. Located in the heart of the Texas Hill Country, Austin offers a blend of natural beauty and urban excitement. The city is famous for its music festivals, including SXSW, and features a thriving food scene with diverse cuisine. Visitors can explore the Texas State Capitol, take a dip in Barton Springs, or enjoy the nightlife on Sixth Street. With a warm climate and a friendly atmosphere, Austin is a city that embraces creativity and diversity.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 950,000
State: Texas
Time Zone: Central Time Zone (UTC-06:00)
Language: English
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Austin has a semi-arid climate with hot summers and mild winters. The city enjoys plenty of sunshine, making it an excellent destination for outdoor activities.

attractions_card.title: The Texas State Capitol
attractions_card.description: The Texas State Capitol is an impressive building and a significant historic site. Visitors can take guided tours and explore the beautiful grounds.

attractions_card.title: Barton Springs Pool
attractions_card.description: Barton Springs Pool is a natural spring-fed swimming pool in Zilker Park, offering a refreshing escape from the Texas heat.

attractions_card.title: South Congress Avenue
attractions_card.description: South Congress Avenue is a lively street with an eclectic mix of shops, restaurants, and live music venues. It's a great place to soak up Austin's culture.

attractions_card.title: Sixth Street Entertainment District
attractions_card.description: The Sixth Street Entertainment District is famous for its nightlife, with a wide range of bars, clubs, and live music venues.

attractions_card.title: Lady Bird Lake
attractions_card.description: Lady Bird Lake is a scenic reservoir in the heart of Austin, offering opportunities for kayaking, paddleboarding, and hiking along the Ann and Roy Butler Hike-and-Bike Trail.

attractions_card.title: The Blanton Museum of Art
attractions_card.description: The Blanton Museum of Art is the largest art museum in Austin, showcasing a diverse collection of art from different time periods and regions.

attractions_card.title: Mount Bonnell
attractions_card.description: Mount Bonnell offers breathtaking views of the city and the Colorado River. It's a popular spot for hikers and photographers.

attractions_card.title: Live Music Venues
attractions_card.description: Austin is known as the 'Live Music Capital of the World.' Visitors can enjoy live performances at various music venues, from intimate clubs to large outdoor stages.

food_card.title: Barbecue
food_card.description: Austin is renowned for its barbecue, with options like brisket, ribs, and sausage. Franklin Barbecue and Micklethwait Craft Meats are local favorites.

food_card.title: Tex-Mex
food_card.description: Tex-Mex cuisine is a must-try, featuring dishes like tacos, enchiladas, and queso. Try local spots such as Matt's El Rancho and Chuy's.

food_card.title: Food Trucks
food_card.description: Austin has a thriving food truck scene, offering a wide range of international cuisines, gourmet donuts, and more.

food_card.title: Breakfast Tacos
food_card.description: Breakfast tacos are a morning staple in Austin. Don't miss out on delicious options from local taco trucks and restaurants.

food_card.title: Craft Beer
food_card.description: Austin has a booming craft beer scene. Visit breweries and brewpubs to taste a variety of locally brewed beers.

hotels_card.title: The Driskill
hotels_card.description: The Driskill is a historic hotel in the heart of downtown Austin, known for its elegant decor and Texas hospitality.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Saint Cecilia
hotels_card.description: Hotel Saint Cecilia is a luxury boutique hotel with a rock 'n' roll vibe, offering uniquely designed rooms and a secluded atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: The LINE Austin
hotels_card.description: The LINE Austin is a modern and stylish hotel located on the shores of Lady Bird Lake, featuring scenic views and vibrant spaces.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Austin
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons Hotel Austin offers luxury accommodations on the banks of Lady Bird Lake, providing a tranquil and upscale stay.

transport_card.title: Austin-Bergstrom International Airport
transport_card.description: Austin-Bergstrom International Airport is the primary airport serving Austin and provides connections to domestic and international destinations.

transport_card.title: Capital Metro
transport_card.description: Capital Metro is Austin's public transportation system, offering bus and commuter rail services for getting around the city.

transport_card.title: Ridesharing Services
transport_card.description: Ridesharing services like Uber and Lyft are widely available in Austin, providing convenient transportation options.

transport_card.title: Biking
transport_card.description: Austin is a bike-friendly city, and you can explore its neighborhoods and trails by renting a bike or using bike-sharing services.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rental agencies are located at the airport and throughout the city, offering flexibility for travelers who want to explore the surrounding areas.
